item.title: 9.2: Deliberate Segfaulting
item.author: fname.lnameA Tkuleuven.be (Wouter Groeneveld and Jo Vliegen)
item.description: source: xkcd.com X A to the Z Run the program below and verify that it runs without errors #include <stdio.h> #define ACTUAL_SIZE 26 #define READ_SIZE 27 int main(void) { unsigned char alphabet[ACTUAL_SIZE]; for(int i=0;i<ACTUAL_SIZE;i++) { alphabet[i] = 97 + i; } for(int i=0;i<READ_SIZE;i++) { printf("%2d -> %c (%02x)\n", i, alphabet[i], alphabet[i]); } return 0; } Recompile the code above, but verify that you have the -0s option added.
